module.name: property_identification
module.keywords: module, property, identification, description, representation, scale, units

purpose.P: This application module specifies the use of a mathematical value to identify an independent property definition.

note.P: This module provides the generalisation of 'representation context' necessary for use of the Mathematical Representation Schema in ISO 10303-50.

example.P: The temperatures are identified by the mathematical space of numbers x ∈ R, where x ≤ -273.15.
Kelvin is a mapping from the space of temperatures to the space of real numbers, which is defined by ISO.
The stress tensors are identified by the mathematical space of symmetric 3×3 matrices.
The mapping between this mathematical space and stress tensors is derived from:

UL.LI: the Pascal mapping from uni-axial stress to the real numbers, which is defined by ISO; and
'my coordinate system', a mapping from orientation to the space of real triples of unit magnitude.

purpose.P: A property space can be any measurable quantity, such as time, position within a geometric space, temperature, density, or mass.

note.P: The mapping between positions within a geometric space and the space of real triples can be a simple Cartesian mapping in metres. There are alternative mappings such as (latitude, longitude and height above MLWS (Mean Low Water Spring tides)) in fathoms and feet.

example.P: The geometric space in which my aeroplane is at rest is a property space. The geometric space in which the earth is at rest is a different property space.

LI.P: the unit of measure used to identify a property value;

example.P: The unit of measure Kelvin is a mapping from the space of temperatures to the space of real numbers.

LI.P: the coordinate system used to identify a property value;
the encoding rule used to identify a property value;

example.P: A strain can be represented by an array of 6 numbers using the mathematical or the engineering convention.
A direction can be represented by a normalised array of 3 numbers which are its direction cosines, or by two Euler angles.

LI.P: the specification of the identification method for a compound property spaces such as (pressure, temperature, density) or (position, temperature), with respect to the identification methods for the individual component property spaces.

note.P: An independent property definition is within the scope of the Independent_property_definition application module.
A property space is within the scope of the Property_space application module.
A maths value is within the scope of the Maths_value application module.
A maths space is within the scope of the Maths_space application module.

description.P: The Property_identification UoF identifies an independent property definition by a maths values. The identification is with respect to a property space.
The Property_scale UoF defines a 1-1 mapping between a property space and a maths space. This mapping is a scale that can be used for the identification of an independent property definition.
